27.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Made of iron. From sideros; made of iron.
A rod, staff, staff of authority, scepter. From the base of rhapizo; a stick or wand.

27.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
27.str2: From sun and the base of tribos; to crush completely, i.e. To shatter.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Of clay, made by a potter, earthen. From keramos; made of clay, i.e. Earthen.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

27.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
27.str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

27.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
27.str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

27.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
27.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

28.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
28.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

28.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
28.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Belonging to the morning, early. From proi; pertaining to the dawn, i.e. Matutinal.
A star. Probably from the base of stronnumi; a star, literally or figuratively.

29.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

29.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
29.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
(a) the ear, (b) met: the faculty of perception. Apparently a primary word; the ear.

29.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
29.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

29.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
29.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

29.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
29.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
